page.title: 01HATCH BEAUCHAMP GAZETTEER
page.content: This is a rural area with mainly dairy farming and a few small industries. Many of the people who live in the area work in local towns. Hatch Beauchamp,the largest settlement has a population of 384. It lies 6 miles outside Taunton, the county town of Somerset. The main road through the village, the A358, is being by_passed. The small Primary School has 45 pupils. The disused railway line runs past the school. The local pub, called the Hatch Inn is being slightly altered and has just changed management. Near the medieval Parish Church of St.John the Baptist,stands Hatch Court, a fine mansion built of Bathstone in the palladian style. Beside this mansion is a deer park with 31 deer including last year' fawns.
